    • Method Detail

      • currentTime

        public static java.lang.String currentTime(int type)

        Returns formatted string of the current date and time:

        Parameters:
        type - int that defines the option of the formatting. Options 1 through 10 are accepted, producing following formatting:

        • Tue Nov 04 20:14:11 EST 2003
        • 11/4/03 8:14 PM
        • 8:14:11 PM
        • Nov 4, 2003 8:14:11 PM
        • 8:14 PM
        • 8:14:11 PM
        • 8:14:11 PM EST
        • 11/4/03 8:14 PM
        • Nov 4, 2003 8:14 PM
        • November 4, 2003 8:14:11 PM EST

        Returns:
        formatted string of the current data

        Thread sleep wrapper

        Parameters:
        t - in milli seconds

        Sleeps for ever

        Parameters:

        public static void keepAlive()

      • buildTopic

        public static java.lang.String buildTopic(java.lang.String domain,
                          java.lang.String subject,
                          java.lang.String type)
                                   throws xMsgException

        Builds xMsg topic of the form: domain:subject:type

        Parameters:
        domain - domain of the message
        subject - subject of the message
        type - type of the message
        Returns:
        xMsg topic
        Throws:
        xMsgException

      • getTopicDomain

        public static java.lang.String getTopicDomain(java.lang.String topic)
                                       throws xMsgException

        Finds the domain of the xMsg topic. Note that xMsg topic is constructed as: domain:subject:type

        Parameters:
        topic - xMsg topic
        Returns:
        domain of the topic
        Throws:
        xMsgException - in case topic does not have a proper xMsg topic construct

      • getTopicSubject

        public static java.lang.String getTopicSubject(java.lang.String topic)
                                        throws xMsgException

        Finds the subject of the xMsg topic. Note that xMsg topic is constructed as: domain:subject:type

        Parameters:
        topic - xMsg topic
        Returns:
        subject of the topic. In case subject is missing in the topic, it returns xMsgConstants.UNDEFINED.
        Throws:
        xMsgException - in case topic does not have a proper xMsg topic construct

      • getTopicType

        public static java.lang.String getTopicType(java.lang.String topic)
                                     throws xMsgException

        Finds the type of the xMsg topic. Note that xMsg topic is constructed as: domain:subject:type

        Parameters:
        topic - xMsg topic
        Returns:
        type of the topic. In case subject is missing in the topic, it returns xMsgConstants.UNDEFINED. Note that type can not be defined if subject is not defined, i.e. xMsg does not support topic such as: domain:*:type
        Throws:
        xMsgException - in case topic does not have a proper xMsg topic construct

      • getLocalHostIps

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLocalHostIps()
                                                        throws java.net.SocketException

        Returns list of IP addresses of a node, that can have multiple network cards, i.e. IP addresses. This method skip loop-back (127.xxx), ink-local (169.254.xxx), multicast (224.xxx through 238.xxx) and broadcast (255.255.255.255) addresses.

        Returns:
        List of IP addresses
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException

      • updateLocalHostIps

        public static void updateLocalHostIps()
                               throws java.net.SocketException

        Returns list of IP addresses of a node, that can have multiple network cards, i.e. IP addresses. This method skip loop-back (127.xxx), ink-local (169.254.xxx), multicast (224.xxx through 238.xxx) and broadcast (255.255.255.255) addresses.

        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException

      • host_to_ip

        public static java.lang.String host_to_ip(java.lang.String hostName)
                                   throws xMsgException,
                                          java.net.SocketException

        Returns the IP address of the specified host

        Parameters:
        hostName - The name of the host (accepts "localhost")
        Returns:
        dotted notation of the IP address
        Throws:
        xMsgException
        java.net.SocketException

      • isIP

        public static boolean isIP(java.lang.String text)

        Utility method that checks to see if passed string is of if decimal form.

        Parameters:
        text - Host name of the computing node.
        Returns:
        true if host name has an IP form.

        Returns:
